PFx: White matter lesions are small changes in the brain that can be seen on an MRI scan. They are like tiny spots or marks that show up in the white matter, which is the part of the brain that helps send messages between different areas. These spots can happen as people get older, and sometimes they don't cause any problems. However, they can also be linked to things like high blood pressure or other health issues. It's important to keep an eye on your overall health and talk to your doctor if you have any concerns.

An arachnoid cyst is like a small, fluid-filled bubble that forms in the brain or spine. It's usually harmless and doesn't cause any problems. Most people don't even know they have one because it doesn't make them feel sick or hurt. Doctors often find these cysts by accident when they are looking at pictures of the brain or spine for other reasons. If the cyst is not causing any trouble, you usually don't need to do anything about it. It's just something to be aware of, like a birthmark.

A pituitary microadenoma is a small, non-cancerous growth in the pituitary gland, which is a tiny organ at the base of your brain. This gland makes important hormones that help control different functions in your body, like growth, metabolism, and stress response. Most of the time, these small growths don't cause any problems and are found by accident during tests for other issues. Sometimes, they can make extra hormones, which might lead to symptoms like headaches or vision changes. It's important to keep an eye on it, but usually, it doesn't need treatment.
